details.title: What was announced in the 3rd tranche?
details.content: After relief measures for small businesses, shadow banks, migrant labourers, street vendors and small farmers, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday announced Rs 1.63 lakh crore package for agriculture, fisheries and allied activities, and paved the way for amendment of Essential Commodity Act and interstate trade for farmers. details.title: Here's the break up of the announcements
A quick recap of the 3rd tranche

details.content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman begins her speech

details.title: Atma Nirbhar Bharat is not about making India isolated
details.content: FM Nirmala Sitharaman clarifies that Atma Nirbhar Bharat is not about making India isolated.

details.title: PM Modi's aims to prepare the country for a tough competition
details.content: Sitharaman said that PM Narendra Modi's goal of self-reliant India is to prepare the country for a tough competition and face challenges of global value chains.

details.title: Structural reforms to be covered today
details.content: Today's announcement to be focussed on structural reforms in the sectors that are going to be the new horizon for growth, more investment can be drawn, more production can be clearly marked, and certainly more employment opportunities can be generated in these sectors: FM

details.title: Upgradation of Industrial Infrastructure
details.content:
• A scheme will be implemented in States through Challenge mode for Industrial Cluster Upgradation of common infrastructure facilities and connectivity

  • Availability of Industrial Land/ Land Bank for promoting new investments and making information available on Industrial Information System (IIS) with GIS mapping

  • 3376 industrial parks/estates/SEZs in 5 lakh hectares mapped on Industrial Information System (IIS)

  • All industrial parks will be ranked in 2020-21

details.title: Many sectors need policy simplification: FM
details.content:
Many sectors need policy simplification, to make it simpler for people to understand what sector can give, participate in activities & bring transparency. Once we decongest sectors, we can boost the sector, for growth and jobs: FM Nirmala Sitharaman pic.twitter.com/l5CGTn91W5

— ANI (@ANI) May 16, 2020

details.title: 4th tranche to focus on 8 sectors
details.content:
1.  Coal

  2. Minerals

  3. Defence Production

  4. Airspace management

  5. Airports

  6. Power distribution companies in Union Territories

  7. Space

  8. Atomic Energy

details.title: Government to promote new champion sectors
details.content: Today's announcements will also include champion sectors and the incentive schemes for the promotion of new champion sectors will be launched in sectors such as solar PV manufacturing, advanced cell battery storage, etc.

details.title: Commercial mining allowed in coal sector
details.content:
There is a need to reduce import of substitutable coal and increase Self reliance in coal production, says FM

The government will introduce competition, transparency and private sector participation n the Coal Sector through:

• Revenue sharing mechanism instead of regime of fixed Rupee/tonne

• Earlier, only captive consumers with end-use ownership could bid

• Now, any party can be for a coal block and sell in the open market

• Entry norms will be liberalized

• Nearly 50 blocks to be offered immediately

• No eligibility conditions, only upfront payment with a ceiling

details.title: Private investments in the mineral sector
details.content:
• Government announces structural reforms to boost growth, employment and bring state-of-the-art technology especially in exploration through the Introduction of seamless composite exploration-cum-mining-eum-production regime

  • Offers 500 mining blocks through an open and transparent auction process

  • Introduces Joint Auction of Bauxite and Coal mineral blocks to enhance Aluminum Industry's competitiveness

  • To help aluminium industry reduce electricity costs

details.content:

  • Offers 500 mining blocks through an open and transparent auction process

  • Introduces Joint Auction of Bauxite and Coal mineral blocks to enhance Aluminum Industry's competitiveness

  • To help aluminium industry reduce electricity costs

details.title: Government to spend Rs 50,000 crore for coal evacuation infrastructure
details.content:
• Coal bed methane extraction will be auctioned

  • Rs 50,000 crore will be spent by the government towards evacuation infrastructure

details.title: Rationalisation of stamp duty payable
details.content:
Rationalisation of stamp duty payable at the time of award of mining leases: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman. pic.twitter.com/znGmRAoqFI

details.title: Sale of unused minerals will be allowed henceforth
details.content: The government allows the sale of surplus and unused minerals by new mining lease facility: FM

details.title: Government puts restriction on imports of certain weapons
details.content:
We need to be self-reliant in the defence sector. High tech equipment can be imported but some of the weapons can be made in India. Certain weapons to be restricted from imports and can only be bought from India: FM Sitharaman

Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman (Photo | ANI)

details.title: FDI limits raised  to 74 per cent
details.content: Foreign Direct Investment limit in defence manufacturing under automatic route is being raised from 49 per cent to 74 per cent: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman

details.title: Separate budget for domestic capital procurement of weapons
details.content: A separate budget will be given for domestic capital procurement so that the armed forces can reduce the import bill, says FM.

details.title: Government takes steps for optimum utilisation of airspace
details.content: Only about 60% of airspace is freely available. Optimum utilisation of airspace to reduce air distance and fuel consumption is necessary: FM

details.title: 6 more airports on the block
details.content: The government puts 6 more airports on auction, does additional investment in 12 airports for world-class facility.

details.title: Restrictions on utilisation of Indian Air Space to be relaxed
details.content: Restrictions on the utilisation of Indian Air Space will be eased so that civilian flying becomes more efficient. Will bring a total benefit of Rs. 1000 crores per year for the aviation sector: Sitharaman.

details.title: Aviation sector to get benefit of Rs 1,000 crore from better utilisation of airports
details.content: Utilisation of airspace will bring a benefit of about Rs 1,000 crore per year for the aviation sector by reducing fuel use and time: FM

details.title: Up to Rs 2000 crore benefit for aviation sector
details.content: Aviation sector to get benefit of Rs 800 crore to Rs 2,000 crore from aircraft maintenance and airframe repair in country from MRO hub, says FM.

details.title: Power distribution companies in UTs privatised
details.content: Power distribution companies in Union Territories will be privatised. Tariff will be applicable according to the government's guidelines: FM Sitharaman

details.title: Bringing stability to power sector
details.content: "Privatisation of the Power distribution companies will bring stability to the power sector. It will help timely payment too," saysFM

details.title: Private sector will be allowed to use ISRO facilities
details.content: The private sector will be allowed to use ISRO facilities and other relevant assets to improve their capacities. Future projects for planetary exploration, outer space travel, etc. to be open for the private sector: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

details.title: Research reactor for production of medical isotopes
details.content: Government to establish a research reactor in the PPE model for the production of medical isotopes for treating cancer and other diseases. India has earned a lot of goodwill from countries where India has exported them: FM Sitharaman

details.title: Measures to leave more cash in hands of people
details.content: Government is taking steps to leave more money in the hands of people now, which will boost demand: FM Sitharaman
Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman concludes the presser

details.title: 5th tranche to be announced at 11 am tomorrow
details.content: The final and the fifth tranche of the announcement to be held at 11 am on Sunday
